vision_analysis.exact_question_text: What further actions would you expect from a brand that claims to be an industry leader?
clickable_elements: Setting ambitious internal targets that push the boundaries of current industry norms
Pioneering new sustainable technologies or business models that can be scaled across the industry
Disclosing any lobbying efforts or policy recommendations they make related to sustainability
Developing and promoting industry best practices for environmental protection and social equity in tea/coffee production
Consistently exceeding industry averages or common practices in their own sustainability performance
Reporting on the collective impact achieved through their industry partnerships and advocacy efforts
Initiating or co-funding cross-industry projects aimed at tackling issues like climate change or poverty in sourcing regions
Hosting or participating in industry conferences and forums to share insights and inspire action

automation.question_text:
What further actions would you expect from a brand that claims to be an industry leader?

We are industry leaders and advocates
We don’t buy all the tea in the market so a sustainable supply chain is not something that we can achieve alone, it takes advocacy and commitment from all those involved, to work together for real impact. We are leading members of the Ethical Tea Partnership, World Coffee Research, the British Coffee Association and more and we encourage others to join this approach.

Please select all that apply
